translated: Högstedt, Per (Peile) Fredrik, Lieutenant Colonel, Eksjö, b. 10/7/98 in Djursihoilto to merchant John H. and Ida Tegné^r. Married in 1932 to Martha Herlenius. Children: Birgitta b. 1933, Jan b. 1937. He graduated from high school in 1917, received his officer's commission in 1919, attended the Army Infantry and Cavalry School in 1921-1922, Royal Swedish Army Staff College in 1922-1923, the Army War College in 1930-1932, served as an officer in the General Staff 1933-1936, in gas defense training in 1936. He was a second lieutenant in the Fortification Corps in 1920, Lieutenant in the Fortification Corps in 1922 and Captain in 1934. He served as a staff officer and Captain in the General Staff Corps in 1937-1939, Captain in the Engineering Corps in 1939, Major in the same corps in 1940, served as a staff officer and Major in the General Staff Corps in 1941, Major in the Defense Staff from 1942, in the Engineering Corps thereafter, Lieutenant Colonel there from 1947. He was stationed in the Gothenburg Engineering Regiment in 1920-1923, 1924-1930, and from 1943, in the Field Telegraph Battalion in 1923-1924, Svea Engineer Regiment in 1930-1936, Boden Engineer Regiment in 1939-1940 and as Inspector of Engineering in 1940-1941. Former head of the Engineering Officers' School in 1932-1933, Commander of the same and the Officer Cadet Company in 1936-1937, staff chief of the Command Staff in Boden 1937-1939, military assistant to the National Military Survey in 1941-1942, and the Swedish Road and Waterways Administration in 1942-1943. He enjoyed outdoor life and sports, particularly horseback riding and skiing, sports fishing, dog sports and hunting. He was awarded the Royal Order of the Sword (RSO), was a member of the Swedish National Sports Federation, the Army Sports Association, the Shooting Association, the Skiing Association, and the Pistol Shooting Association.

structured.name: Per Fredrik Högstedt
structured.description: Per Fredrik Högstedt was a Swedish Lieutenant Colonel born on July 10, 1898 in Djursihoilto to merchant John Högstedt and Ida Tegné^r. He graduated from high school in 1917 and received his officer's commission in 1919. He served in various capacities in the Royal Swedish Army, including the General Staff Corps and Engineering Corps. He was stationed in several different regiments including the Gothenburg Engineering Regiment and the Boden Engineer Regiment. He was awarded the Royal Order of the Sword (RSO) and was a member of several sports associations.
